p: Several statistical methods have been used to test whether a specific taxonomic group is over- or underrepresented in an ethnobotanical flora in comparison to overall local flora. Although the linear regression analysis [ 21] and binomial analysis [ 24] have been widely used, more recent studies have pointed out some limitations in these previous analytical methods, and propose a Bayesian approach in order to analyse the over- and underused plant groups [ 22, 23]. This method allows us to consider the uncertainty of the proportion of medicinal plant species in the overall flora and shows its robustness in small datasets [ 22].
